intro: Semiramisia lanigera, commonly known as the woolly semiramisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Europe and western Asia, where it typically grows in rocky or dry habitats. The plant is characterized by its finely hairy, often grayish foliage and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in umbel-like clusters. It is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained soils and can tolerate harsh environmental conditions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and naturalized areas.
